intro: Astroloma serratifolium, commonly known as the serrated leaf astroloma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are serrated, giving it the species name "serratifolium," which translates to "serrated leaf." Astroloma serratifolium is a low-growing shrub that thrives in well-drained environments and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat.
